body.name: KLEVERISE Shoe Rack 10 Tiers Narrow Shoe Organizer, Tall Shoe Rack for Entryway, Sturdy Metal Shoe Shelf for 20-25 Pairs Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 12 hrs 32 mins
features: High-quality - The shoe shelf fabric is made of a durable waterproof non-woven layer, reinforced PP connectors and powder-coated metal tubes, providing good stability to withstand large and heavy objects; effectively preventing dust, water, or mud from falling into other shoes.

Easy to assemble - No tools needed. Simply put the tube into the hole and assemble it by hand. Comes with a wooden hammer, which is more labor-saving. Please refer to the manual instruction in package.

Space-saving - Stores up to 20-25 pairs of shoes; if you need to store tall boots and larger items, one layer can be removed and a tall compartment created. This rack is not only for shoes, but also for bags, toys, towel, sundries, books, plants and small accessories.
Measures - This shoe stands measures 11"D x 17.6"W x 68.7"H. perfectly storage for your closet, entryway, dormitory, apartments, garage, etc.
Optional Features - The shoe rack meet diverse needs. You can remove the layer to fit boots, high heels or larger accessories, or split it up into 2 shoe racks with different layers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I didn't actually get this for shoes, but for bulky sweaters. We are moving, and my husband's closet is very shallow, just barely deep enough for items on hangers. But it's long, and this shoe rack fits perfectly in the corner for all his big sweaters. This frees up another area for me to store my sweaters, so we both benefit! So glad I got this, and for the price, I'm quite pleased with the quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good shelf for filling a small gap in your closet
reviews.reviewText: This assembled relatively easily, and was easy to tuck into my closet to add more room to stash my shoes. The unit is relatively strong, but not nearly as strong as a, say, wooden shelf of the same dimensions would be. If you are counting on this to be kept out away from any side to side support--by the front door, say--I would caution you to make sure one side is up against a wall. I think this will last a long time where I have it now--wedged between my dresser and a tote bin in my clothes closet. It adds valuable shelves for shoes, but I don't have to worry about it swaying from side to side and possibly bending and breaking because it has support on either side.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I finally put it together last night. It's made of plastic, so lightweight, shelves hold about 2 pairs of shoes each, I was hoping for more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Much better than having shoes all over the floor
reviews.reviewText: I got tired of having shoes all over the floor of our entryway. Even though I haven't put all my shoes on the rack yet, I am already very happy with this product.The organizer went together easily. All the parts were there along with instructions and a wooden hammer. While I currently have it set up as a single unit with a shelf at every layer, I appreciate that if I decide to I can split it into different units and/or remove shelves to create areas for taller shoes. With two pairs of shoes per layer, there should be plenty of room for my son and me to have all our shoes in this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great shoe rack
reviews.reviewText: This shoe rack is great. Even though it's plastic, it is strong and holds my boots just fine..I love that I can change the configuration to fit my needs and it's easy to rearrange.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars this not a metal
reviews.reviewText: this product is all plastic not metal as describe. you have to be very careful in assembling this product, the plastic is not sturdy and will break easily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for a family
reviews.reviewText: My kids needed a better place for all their shoes. They are 5 and 8 and have a ton from grandparents and the shoe bin method wasn't working. They wear a few pairs religiously and they weren't putting them back in the bins and then they'd be left all over the house with the kids asking me what shoes to wear. They'd finally check the bin and, inevitably, shoes they forgot about no longer fit.I did modify this set, though. It make a nice, tall, 10 layer rack. My kids are tall, but not that tall. I removed 2 layers and put them in the living room for me. Each kid gets 4 rows to fit shoes and they were able to downsize from there. The shelves are a little narrow, so boots aren't going to fit, except on the top rack. You could modify the set though and use the mid length bars to make a few taller shelves.Overall a very versatile piece that fit perfectly in our office and the kids love it. For kids or someone that is neurdivergent and needs to see their shoes to know which ones they have, this set it great. It's not closed away, but everything looks neat and tidy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This Rack Rackin' em Up!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. When I first opened this box I was little worried when I saw all the bars and plastic pieces. Im use to building furniture, so I went straight to the instruction! After I got the first few pieces connected and attached I realized it wouldn’t be as hard as I originally excepted! It does take some time and patience, but it’s a relatively simply process.The metal bars and plastic pieces are made with lightweight material. It is solid and stable when set in one spot but can be knocked over easily when empty or given a little force. The upside to that is that it’s easy to move from one place to another.Inside the box:* Metal bars, Plastic connecting pieces and Fabric shelvesPros* Simple instructions* Easy to relocate from one place to another* Plenty shelf space for shoes* Easy to create space for larger items if necessaryCons* Lightweight material makes shelf easy to shakeIf you were looking for an easy to use shoe organizer for your house, apartment, or small living set up this could be a great option for you! Assembly takes some time but it’s not overly complicated. 20 to 30 minutes tops if you’re doing it while watching TV like I did lol. This shoe rack is compact enough that it won’t take up a ton of extra space. So if you’re a person who is looking for organization and efficiency, this will be a great fit for you!
